title: Tour in Morocco: Everlasting Experience (Marcus L)
text: By Marcus L Oct 12, 2015 Morocco is a journey into an everlasting, peaceful world of cute coastal villages, colorful painted towns that hang to hillsides and remote outposts fortified by fairytale adobe forts. It is a wondrous and exotic place with snake charmers and jugglers, hordes of treasures and endless glasses of mint tea. It's also an adventure into some of North Africa's most dazzling scenery with the desert on its doorstep and the lined heights of the Atlas Mountains beyond. This mesmerizing country is a combination of the African and Arab humanity, and is steeped in age-old customs. Morocco has four Imperial Cities and each of them is a capital at least once and several times for a couple. They are: Fes (Fez), Marrakesh, Rabat and Meknes.Fes: It is Morocco's big cultural destination. Fes el Bali (Old City) is an authentic chaos of a place where it is impossible to not get lost. The pathways with chipped plaster-work and attractive old doors attract everybody to take photos on every corner, while the foul-smelling tanneries are one of Fes' most popular attractions for those who can handle the smell.Rabat: It has a heavy French influence and houses of the King and embassies. Its main languages are Arabic and French. Most popular place of Rabat are the abandoned mosque with the incomplete Hassan Tower, the Royal residence (Dar-al-Makhzen), Pietri Square, the Bouregreg Marina, the Kasbah of the Udayas, the Rabat Archaeological Museum and the Riad district. There are various gardens, museums and zoo that are also very famous for tourism and they are: Zoo de Rabat, the stunning Andalusian Gardens, Les Jardins Exotiques de Bouknadel, the Mausoleum of Mohammad V, the Museum Mohamed VI of Modern and Contemporary Art, and the must visit Chellah, an ancient Roman ruin. Marrakesh: The busy and energetic noise of Marrakesh Medina attracts more visitors. The entrance to the old city is from the vast plaza of Djemma el-fna Square. Once the person entered the Medina itself, he enters a world of web-like alleyways and shopkeeper hustle. It's an experience of full of colorful and noisy local life, and Moroccan sightseeing trails.Meknes: It is partially surrounded by ancient walls encompassing exquisite gates like Bab Mansour which is one of the best-preserved of the Islamic world. Some noteworthy sights in the Meknes are the Bou Inania Medersa, Dar Al-Makhzen, the Mausoleum of Moulay Ismail, Jamai Palace, the Museum of Moroccan Arts and the El Hedim Square.Morocco is situated in the North Africa with the coast of Mediterranean Sea and Atlantic Ocean. Tours in Morocco can be enjoyed along with food, economy, education, transport, Fes guesthouse, Sahara desert, Berber tents and camel trek.
